text:
A 23-year-old labourer was killed and 26 others were injured when a slab of an under-construction building in the Chhattisgarh High Court premises collapsed on Tuesday, police said.

The police suspect that some labourers are trapped under the rubble where around 100 of them were working at the time of the accident.“The incident occurred at the upcoming Judicial Officers’ Training Institute building being built on the Chhattisgarh High Court premises, around 10 km away from here towards Raipur,” said Bilaspur Superintendent of Police Abhishek Pathak.

The labourers were working at the site when the portion of slab, which was being laid, caved in around 4 p.m., he said, adding that a team of police personnel was immediately rushed to the spot.

Rescuers initially found 25 labourers injured and rushed them to a local hospital.

Later, two other labourers who were trapped under the debris were evacuated and admitted to Apollo Hospital where one of them died of his injuries during treatment, the SP said.

The deceased has been identified as Toman Porte (23) of Akaltara town in Janjgir-Champa district. — PTI
title: Worker dies as slab collapses
